Attackdex

Name Type Category PP Power Accuracy Description
Absorb 25 30 100 A nutrient-draining attack. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
Apple Acid 10 80 100 The target is hit with an acid created from tart apples. This also lowers its Sp. Def stat.
Aromatherapy 5 — — The user releases a soothing scent that heals all status conditions affecting its party.
Bramble Snag 15 60 100 The user shreds the target with sharp brambles. This also lowers its Speed stat.
Branch Poke 40 40 100 The user attacks the target by poking it with a sharply pointed branch.
Bullet Seed 30 25 100 The user forcefully shoots seeds at the target two to five times in a row.
Burn Powder 30 — 80 The user covers the target in a flammable powder. This leaves it with a burn.
Chloroblast 5 150 95 The user launches amassed chlorophyll at the foe. This also hurts the user.
Cotton Guard 10 — — The user wraps its body in soft cotton, which drastically raises its Defense stat.
Cotton Spore 40 — 100 The user's cotton-like spores cling to opposing Pokémon, harshly lowering Speed stats.
Drum Beating 10 80 100 The user controls its drum's roots to attack the target. This also lowers its Speed stat.
Energy Ball 10 90 100 The user draws nature's power and fires it at the target. This may also lower its Sp. Def stat.
Flower Trick 10 70 — The user throws a bouquet that never misses and always lands a critical hit.
Forest's Curse 20 — 100 The user puts a forest curse on the target. The target is now Grass type as well.
Frenzy Plant 5 150 90 The user slams the target with the roots of an enormous tree but can't move on the next turn.
Giga Drain 10 75 100 A nutrient-draining attack. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
Grass Knot 20 — 100 The target is snared with grass and tripped. The heavier it is, the greater the move's power.
Grass Pledge 10 80 100 When used with its water equivalent, its power increases and a vast swamp appears.
Grass Whistle 15 — 55 The user plays a pleasant melody that lulls the target into a deep sleep.
Grassy Glide 20 70 100 The user glides on the ground into the target. This always goes first on Grassy Terrain.
Grassy Terrain 10 — — For 5 turns, the HP of grounded Pokémon is restored and Grass type-moves are stronger.
Grav Apple 10 80 100 The user drops an apple onto the target from above. This also lowers its Defense stat.
Horn Leech 10 75 100 The user's horns drain the target's energy, restoring its HP by half the damage dealt.
Ingrain 20 — 100 The user lays roots that restore its HP on every turn but can no longer switch out.
Ivy Cudgel 10 100 100
Jungle Healing 10 — — The user restores HP and cures any status conditions of itself and its ally Pokémon in battle.
Leaf Blade 15 90 100 The user handles a sharp leaf like a sword to cut its target. Critical hits land more easily.
Leaf Storm 5 130 90 The user whips up a storm of leaves. The recoil harshly lowers the user's Sp. Atk stat.
Leaf Tornado 10 65 90 The user encircles its target in sharp leaves. This attack may also lower its accuracy.
Leafage 40 40 100 The user attacks by pelting the target with leaves.
Leech Seed 10 — 90 A seed is planted on the target. It steals some HP from the target every turn.
Magical Leaf 20 60 — The user scatters curious leaves that chase the target. This attack never misses.
Mana Sap 10 — 100 The user drains the target's Sp. Atk stat, restoring its HP but having its own Sp. Atk stat fall.
Matcha Gotcha 15 80 90
Mega Drain 15 55 100 A nutrient-draining attack. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
Needle Arm 15 60 100 The user attacks by wildly swinging its thorny arms. It may also make the target flinch.
Oxidize 5 — — The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.
Petal Blizzard 15 90 100 The user stirs up a violent petal blizzard and attacks everything around it.
Petal Dance 10 120 100 The user attacks by scattering petals for two to three turns and then becomes confused.
Power Whip 10 120 85 The user violently whirls its vines, tentacles, or the like to harshly lash the target.
Razor Leaf 25 55 95 Sharp-edged leaves are launched at opposing Pokémon. Critical hits land more easily.
Sappy Seed 15 90 100 The user grows a gigantic stalk that scatters Leech Seeds to attack the target.
Seed Bomb 15 80 100 The user slams a barrage of hard-shelled seeds down on the target from above.
Seed Flare 5 120 85 The user emits a shock wave. This may also harshly lower the target's Sp. Def stat.
Sleep Powder 15 — 75 The user scatters a big cloud of sleep-inducing dust around the target.
Snap Trap 15 35 100 The user snares the target in a snap trap for four to five turns.
Solar Beam 10 120 100 A two-turn attack. The user gathers light, then blasts a bundled beam on the next turn.
Solar Blade 10 125 100 The user fills a blade with the light's energy, attacking the target on the next turn.
Spicy Extract 15 0 — A spicy extract sharply lowers the target's Defense but sharply raise Attack.
Spiky Shield 10 — — This move protects the user from attacks and damages any attacker that makes contact.
Spore 15 — 100 The user scatters bursts of spores that induce sleep.
Strength Sap 10 — 100 The user restores its HP by the same amount as the target's Attack stat and lowers it.
Stun Spore 30 — 75 The user scatters a cloud of numbing powder that paralyzes the target.
Synthesis 5 — — The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.
Syrup Bomb 10 60 85 Coats the target in sticky candy syrup. It's speed drops each turn for three turns.
Trailblaze 20 50 100 Performs a leaping attack with nimble footwork. This boosts the user's Speed stat.
Trop Kick 15 70 100 The target is hit by an intense kick of tropical origins. This also lowers its Attack stat.
Vine Whip 25 45 100 The target is struck with slender, whiplike vines to inflict damage.
Wood Hammer 15 120 100 The user slams its rugged body into the target to attack but is also damaged quite a lot.
Worry Seed 10 — 100 A seed that causes worry is planted on the target, making all target abilities Insomnia.
